item.title: There are a number of potholes just as you turn into Folland Ave from the main road, 5th February
item.description:
The potholes - which seem to be getting increasingly worse - are just inside the turning to Folland Ave by the traffic lights. Probably continue for approx 100 yards down the road heading towards the mini roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Folland Avenue, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 5th February
item.description:
I want to draw your attention to an issue we have with regards to the pedestrian crossing outside GCHQ. We have counted several times each cycle and on average the lights were on red for 17 seconds. We hoped that this could be reduced to more like 10-12 seconds. For a number of months, we have been looking to try to improve the flow of traffic outside of the site, which at times, becomes very difficult for everyone and is regularly resulting in lengthy tailbacks around the site. This, in turn, causes issues and delays for road users unconnected to the site and regularly contributes to problems on the nearby A40, and as far back as the M5 junction 11.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Approximately 50 pot holes of varying sizes all the way down Kyderminster Road, 5th February
item.description:
This Road is littered with potholes all the way down through the estate which at some point soon cause many punctures. None have been marked and some are looking like they have been there some time. The entire road is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lighting on the drive between Griffith Ave and The Knole, 5th February
item.description:
I understand that the driveway between Griffith Avenue and the Knole is council owned. Specifically between Griffith Avenue and the fork in the drive (where it splits to The Knole or The Granleys). There is no street lighting here which means it is very dark during the winter months and vulnerable people use the driveway but find it difficult to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5a;5b, Chad Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 5th February
item.description:
Customer reports that when the road was resurfaced, the drain outside the location was covered over. Since then, water pools in the carriageway and this appears to be getting bigger and bigger. Please can Highways investigate.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 5th February

item.title: Huge deep pot hole, 5th February
item.description:
Best the rising sun. Very big and dangerous to cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Needless barriers, 5th February
item.description:
Barriers around a damaged permanent barrier near pedestrain crossing. You are placing these barriers everytime a permanent barrier is damaged but there seems to be no risk assessment or common sense applied. They make the place look unsightly, reduce the width of the pavement and stay for months while you find time to do the repair. Please implement a better system to deal with this problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor
